Mr. SUBRAMANYAM. Mr. Speaker, I rise today because I have heard from  a lot of my colleagues about a nationwide shortage in professional  fields like teaching, nursing, and social work. Our communities have  done a lot of work to address these shortages so we can keep our  hospitals and clinics and schools open. However, between pay, student  loans, and…

…policies will also impede access to graduate education and, by  extension, exacerbate workforce shortages in professional fields such  as teaching, behavioral health, and social work.
